actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide individuals an income tax credit of up to $1,500 for each new American-made passenger automobile acquired by the taxpayer.
short_title: Domestic Auto Incentive Tax Act of 1982

summary.text: Domestic Auto Incentive Tax Act of 1982 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers an income tax credit equal to ten percent of the cost of purchasing between March 2, 1982, and January 1, 1988, a new 1982 or later model American-made passenger automobile. Limits such credit to $1,500.

titles.title: Domestic Auto Incentive Tax Act of 1982
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide individuals an income tax credit of up to $1,500 for each new American-made passenger automobile acquired by the taxpayer.
